reset.body: Are you sure you want to reset all your progress? All data will be lost, including coins and avatars.

store.content1: Hey, if you're here it means you are enjoying this portfolio, thank you! Here you can acquire new avatars with the coins you earned. Keep visiting the other rooms to get all of them!

question1.title: What is this?
question1.content: This is a portfolio structured as a game. Each room will be showing a different piece of information and you will gather coins as you explore it. The intention is that it is at least a little funnier for you, when compared to a Times New Roman resumé.

question2.title: To whom is this for?
question2.content: In general, to anyone interested in portfolios. That would embrace: clients, employers, recruiters and anyone that is just curious.

question3.title: What will I find here?
question3.content: Essentially, this is a portfolio, so you will find projects I've made, professional experience, technical background and so on. I took the liberty to add a few more things, though. To find them out, just explore each room while earning coins.

question4.title: How do I use it?
question4.content: If you have a keyboard, use the arrows to navigate, press Enter to visit a room and Esc to return to home. Alternatively, click on the rooms and links to do the exact same thing. The mobile version mimics the desktop in the sense that you should "move" through rooms, rather than "skipping" to the last one.

question5.title: Why is it a game?
question5.content: It is due to the fact that it sounds tedious to read portfolios that are "content-only", like a resumé. Moreover, it was like a study for me, as I could learn some new technologies.

question6.title: Who made this?
question6.content: My name is Vicente Knihs Erbs, nice to meet you. I'm a Full-Stack software developer based in Brazil. You can find me on

worldhousingapi.name: World Housing API
worldhousingapi.skills: Django REST Framework, REST APIs, Next,js, Chakra UI
worldhousingapi.content: An open-source API that provides housing data for each country in terms of monthly variation and square-meter pricing. It is publicly available on Github:

petalaquinto.name: Pétala Quinto's Website
petalaquinto.content: If you don't know yet, I'm in a band called Pétala Quinto. This project is about the website I have built for it using React, SASS and the react-bootstrap front-end framework. The UI was pretty much inspired on Spotify's web player and the design is fully responsive (I wonder why would anyone develop something that is not responsive nowadays). You can check it at

portfolio.name: Game Portfolio
portfolio.skills: JavaScript, ReactJS, Redux, SASS, Material UI
portfolio.content: Game Portfolio is actually this page, as one might presume. It is essentially a front-end project, with no back-end, which helped me develop a better knowledge of JavaScript, React and Redux. It's also developed over a framework named Material UI: an implementation of Google's Material Design guidelines.

airQuality.name: Air Quality Mapping System
airQuality.content: Personal project that acquires data about the air quality and sends that data to an Android app using a microcontroller and a Bluetooth module. It was a really complete system, going from electronic and mechanical hardware to a mobile app and storing data to the cloud. The app would control the frequency of the data acquaintance, store it on a Firebase cloud NoSQL database and display the quality on a Google Maps view. The system was completely mobile, so one could attach its 3D printed case to a vehicle and map the air quality of a certain region. This project originated a paper which was published on the II Brazilian Interdisciplinary Congress in Science and Technology.

loraLisha.name: LoRa Mesh
loraLisha.skills: IoT, C/C++, embedded systems, hardware design
loraLisha.content: Research made at Software/Hardware Integration Lab (LISHA) UFSC aiming to integrate a LoRa Mesh module to the microcontroller and operating system developed at the lab. LoRa is a protocol for network communication focused on IoT, with a wide range and low power consumption. Mesh relates to the topology adopted by that module, and it's not an usual topology for LoRa. I ended up developing abstractions in C/C++ and a Printed Circuit Board (PCB) for that integration with the module.

thinkTank.name: Think Tank
thinkTank.skills: Soft Skills, Leadership, Design Thinking, Theory U
thinkTank.content: It's a project idealized by the NGO Projeto Resgate, where leaders from several organizations and college students develop soft skills by applying Design Thinking and Theory U to solve real-world problems. First, I took part in the project as usual, then I moved into organizing it and training the leaders along with the creators of the project. Learn about the Think Tank Project:

kimak.name: Kimak's Website
kimak.skills: PHP, MySQL, Bootstrap, JQuery, web development (HTML, CSS and JS)
kimak.content: This was my first real-life CMS website project, developed using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, MySQL, Bootstrap and JQuery. The site is not available anymore.

pollux.company: Pollux, Part of Accenture - Joinville, Brazil
pollux.content: Full-Stack developer, not only with back-end and front-end responsibilities, but also handling IIoT (Industrial Internet of Things) with RaspberryPi's and server setups. The company is focused on robotics and automation as part of Accenture's Industry X services. The stack is basically composed of Python, relational databases (PostgreSQL and SQLite), Bootstrap and jQuery. Moreover, several hardwares were integrated and other technologies such as ReactJS, FastAPI, Docker and Docker-Compose joined the stack.

redsoft.content: Startup focused on bringing the 4.0 revolution to the meat industry. It is a spin-off from Pix Force - awarded as the greatest computing vision startup in Brazil by 100 Open Startups - and iBeef, specialized in the meat industry. I work as a Full-Stack Developer, mostly working with Python, Flask, React and TypeScript. Other technologies include some AWS cloud services, Docker and Docker Compose for containerization and Azure DevOps tools. I had the opportunity to join the company in its first steps, and now our system has been implemented in relevant companies in this sector, which led me to take ownership over its development.

coffee.content1: Hey, I'm glad you are interested in my portfolio! Sometimes I feel that portfolios are too impersonal or cold, like a resumé in Times New Roman. If you want to, I would like to share a little of what I do beyond working and coding - things that make me feel like me.
coffee.content2: First of all, music has been part of my life since I was a child. Right now, I'm the bassist of what I would classify as an Indie Rock band. It's called Pétala Quinto and we write our own songs. Check it out at
coffee.content3: or wherever you want to - other streamings platforms or even on
coffee.content4: It's something important for me. Moreover, it has given me several opportunities, for instance for volunteering.
coffee.content5: Luckily, I could participate in some volunteering projects. Now, there are two that I take part: Escola dos Anjos and Movimento Campista.
coffee.content6: Escola dos Anjos, roughly translated to Angel's School, is a social project where needy children between 8 and 12 years old enjoy a day playing and learning "how an angel behaves on earth". Since 2018, I participate mostly with the music interactions and any infrastructure organization required in my home city. Learn about Escola dos Anjos on Escola dos Anjos' Instagram profile:
coffee.content7: Movimento Campista involves Catholic camping retreats separated in different age groups, where I've been taking part in the music teams for children and teenagers since 2017.

contact.content2: Here are a few possibilities to contact me.
contact.content3: Feel free to contact me anytime, I'm always open to any conversation!

library.content1: Surprisingly enough, I have a Bachelor's degree in Mechatronics Engineering from Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina (UFSC), with Academic Honors. UFSC is among the best LATAM universities, if you're a curious person you can learn more at
library.content2: Usually, no one knows what mechatronics is about, so let me briefly explain it. It is something like mechanics + electronics + computing. The main focus for us was on embedded systems, which include microcontrollers, real-time operating systems, some electronics and not so much mechanics.
library.content3: That creates a foundation over a broad set of subjects - and that's the main reason I've chosen mechatronics. We learn about: Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), PLC, FPGAs, microcontrollers, operating systems, networking, control, power electronics, motors, materials, structures, to name a few.
library.content4: For sure, I've found out that "my thing" is software. No mechanics and not that much electronics. I had learnt to code before choosing to pursue any degree, but it was during those years that I knew I would become a software engineer.
library.content5: Now that you know about what I've studied formally, why not continuing to explore other rooms?
library.omscs1: I am currently pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science at Georgia Institute of Technology. It is a disruptive program named Online Master in Computer Science (OMSCS), in one of the best universities in the world, especially in engineering and computer science. More information at
